column1: # If you used a microstate other than the challenge provided microstate (`SMXX_micro000`)

column1: # Use as many lines of text as you need.
# All text following the 'Method:' keyword will be regarded as part of your free text methods description.

This submission set is designed as a null model which predicts logP of all molecules as the mean clogP of FDA approved oral new chemical entities (NCEs) between the years 1998 and 2017 based on the analysis of Micheal D.Shultz (2019) [1].
Mean clogP of FDA approved oral NCEs approved between 1900-1997
StarDrop clogP calculations [2] were used for this analysis.
We calculated the mean of NCEs approved between 1998 – 2017
column3: as the early drugs tend to be much smaller and much more hydrophilic than the ones being developed nowadays.

column2: Michael D. “Two Decades under the Influence of the Rule of Five and the Changing Properties of Approved Oral Drugs: Miniperspective.” Journal of Medicinal Chemistry 62

column1: # All submissions must either be ranked or non-ranked.

# Non-ranked submissions are accepted so we can verify that they were made before the deadline.
